name: electricity production, nuclear, pressure water reactor | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2276/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity at a grid-connected nuclear pressure water reactor (PWR) in Germany in 2012.;It is a copy of the dataset "electricity production, nuclear, pressure water reactor, CH, 1995-2002", i.e. of a dataset with data for a Swiss nuclear PWR. The basic source for all exchanges is therefore the ecoinvent report "Kernenergie" (see Modelling and Administrative).  ;The average burnup 53 MWd/kg heavy metal of finally discharged fuel elements from the 2000/2002 fuel cycles has been assumed representative for the lifetime of the modeled plant (the burnup has increased from the initial about 33 MWd/kg heavy metal and may increase to 55 MWd/kg heavy metal in the future). The average burnup corresponds to an average enrichment of 4.2% U235 for fresh uranium fuel elements. Over the lifetime of the plant it can be assumed that 8% of the energy will be produced by MOX fuel elements. Of total fuel elements 92% are assumed to be from fresh U (thus burdened by the full upstream chain), and 8% MOX (burdened by reprocessing). For the calculation of the total net electricity delivered in 40 years lifetime, the sum of the actual production till 2002 and the prospective (8000 GWh/a) till end of life using  is considered; this gives 3.11E11 kWh; the inverse gives the utilisation factor for the infrastructure. Partial information on material requirements during operation for 1991/1992 are available, which are integrated with relevant information for the modeled boiling water reactor. The diesel requirements for the yearly test of diesel emergency generators are accounted for. Radioactive emission species to air and water are weighted averages of the emissions of the nuclear power plants GÃ¶sgen and Beznau I+II from 1995 to 2002. Alpha aerosols emission to air have been described with "aerosols, unspecified". Considered radioactive waste streams are: spent fuel to reprocessing (40%) and conditioning (60%); operational low active waste for conditioning in the intermediate repository; and, contaminated waste from dismantling.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

From the constructed power plant ready to produce electricity and from the fuel ready in the power plant.

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and arrived at the busbar.

The module includes fuel elements, chemicals, and diesel requirements as well as the relevant transport requirements. Water use for cooling is included, but no cooling tower infrastructure. Considered radioactive waste streams are: spent fuel to conditioning (no reprocessing); operational low active waste for conditioning in the intermediate repository; and, contaminated waste from dismantling. Non-radioactive wastes are accounted for.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2012
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Swiss data of one specific plant for requirements and all German PWRs for emissions.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
This datasets is based on a dataset valid for Switzerland (CH). Data quality for this Swiss dataset is high. Geographical uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

The Swiss dataset is valid for the whole lifetime of the reactor. Temporal uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Literature, statistics of radioactive emissions, and information from operators.

exchanges.description:
Estimated average net electricity production per year: 7.78E9 kWh/y (Tab. 9.3, p. 166)
Water use in BWR see Tab. 9.17 p.196 in Dones et al. - decarbonised water use (700 kg/s)
own estimation. 
It is estimated that all decarbonised water in the mentioned table is evaporated.
In contrast to the literature reference and the datasets in ecoinvent version 2, this dataset only takes into account real water use, i.e. the water which is evaporated during the cooling process.

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature (Scown, C.D., et al., 2011, Water Footprint of U.S. Trasportation Fuels;Scown, C.D., et al., 2011, Water Footprint of U.S. Trasportation Fuels (SI); Stiegel, 2008, Estimating Freshwater Needs to Meet Future Thermoelectric Generation Requirements; Floerke, M., 2009, Future changes of freshwater needs in the electricity production sector), (Vionnet, S., Quantis Water Database - Technical Report, 2012). Water use in this process is modelled based on literature (see references). The process boundaries are given by the boundaries of the power plant. The process ends when the energy (MJ) is produced and ready to be used for electricity production (kWh).
